Played enough to realize how this game favours camping in a corner. This makes the people who are the fastest to pick the MG class the advantage in the game as you only need to capture a point and hide in a pixel walk where people don't expect you. I seriously would not recommend this game if you are looking for a fun time.

Day of Defeat: Source is a very good WW2 fps game! So your main focus here is to achieve as many objectives and kills as possible helpin' your team win over the other in rounds. Gameplay is awesome. It's co-op. Controls are super easy to adapt. Graphics are simple like the classic Valve graphics. An 8/10 from me.

The type of gameplay presented by this game was very dissapointing. there was no origanality or respect for the setting of the game. if you add the small and terrible cliche mic chat community to that then you get a game with the team mates of TF2 and the gameplay of CS:GO without jump and shoot. this did not feel like a game that deserved anyone's time and did not in anyway portray the importance of the period and setting, but simply used them as a  back drop to utalize some already established class sytems.

Give it a try, it's only $0.99 right now.

It's not for me though. Maps are designed badly, gun play is meh, but the game has a solid concept. A fast paced--dare I say--COD style shooter should not have guns that have insane recoil. I played on 3 different maps and all of them were either very one team sided, or was even but there was way too many angles to keep track of.

Day of Defeat: Source may not have aged as well as other Valve classics, but fans of FPS games will treasure the nostalgia. The game has a surpsisingly high skill ceiling, with many features that players will be familiar with other titles. The faction, class, map and weapon variety are very limited, but that will not distract from the overall experience. The community is not big, but strong and there will always be a few servers open with a lot of players. The gameplay, while sometimes repetitive and mundane, will grow on most overtime, but will turn down people looking for a casual shooter. The graphics look good, the Source engine continues to delight. Overall, Day of Defeat: Source is a fun, tactical and old-school shooter fused with a WW2 flavour. Rating: 8/10

In terms of scale, it barely comes up to Battlefield's ankles, and in terms of tactics and tension it can't beat Counter-Strike, but once you've spent a few hours on a server of 20 or so people, you'd have to want not to enjoy it to fail to - and your own war stories are an inevitable byproduct.

-Купил игру по скидке
-Зашёл на сервак,пусто
-Увидил другой серв,захожу
-Зашёл,слышу как две дяденьки между собой общаются
-Услышал в их разговоре,что одному 35 лет,а другому 39,офигел от аудитории данной игры
-Общаются про то сколько зарабатывают,один по 120 тыс.руб.,другой 60 тыс.руб.
-У дяденьки,которму 39 лет есть только жена,у другого же ребёнок и жена
-Обсуждают,как ставить батареи и как их разогревать
-К их разговору подключились ещё трое

Çok güzel bir fizik motoru var oynarken insana zevk veriyor ve grafikleri yeterli düzeyde ayrıca güncel sistemler ile iyi çalışıyor kesinlikle tavsiye ediyorum.

Olumlu yönleri:
+İçerdiği nostalji beni benden aldı
+Vuruş hissi güzel
+Silah çeşitliliği yeterli
+Karakter seçenekleri yeterli
+Grafikler iyi
+Fizikler güzel

Olumsuz yönleri:
-Oyunu artık oynayan yok
